original: @164b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @164b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: ae ka dz'a t'i s'a dha nam /
analyzed: ae ka dz'a t'i s'a dha nam /
translated: Ekajaṭī sādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: ral pa gcig ma'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: ral pa gcig ma'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The means of achieving Ekajaṭī

original: 'phags ma ae ka dz'a t'i la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags ma ae ka dz'a t'i la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Noble Ekajaṭī.

original: aom a'a:h'um aom badzra yo gi n'i pra t'itstsha mam ba lim hr'im h'um ha ha ha ha he he ham ha:phat ma ma sh'antim ku ru sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um aom badzra yo gi n'i pra t'itstsha mam ba lim hr'im h'um ha ha ha ha he he ham ha:phat ma ma sh'antim ku ru sv'ah'a /
translated: Om āḥ hūṃ. Om vajra yoginī pṛthivī maṇḍala hriṃ hūṃ ha ha ha ha he he haḥ phaṭ. Mama śāntiṃ kuru svāhā.

original: aom a'a:ral'i ham zhes pa la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a:ral'i ham zhes pa la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Om āḥ rali haṃ and so forth should be recited.

original: de nas rab tu bshad bya ba //
analyzed: de nas rab tu bshad bya ba //
translated: Then, what is to be fully explained,

original: phyag gnyis ral gcig sgrub pa'i thabs //
analyzed: phyag gnyis ral gcig sgrub pa'i thabs //
translated: The means of achieving Ekajaṭī with two arms,

original: ral gcig kham pa gyen brdzes pa'i //
analyzed: ral gcig kham pa gyen brdzes pa'i //
translated: Ekajaṭī with hair standing upward,

original: lha mo gri gug thod pa bsnams //
analyzed: lha mo gri gug thod pa bsnams //
translated: The goddess holding a flaying knife and skull cup,

original: de bzhin lha mo phyag bzhi ma //
analyzed: de bzhin lha mo phyag bzhi ma //
translated: Likewise the four-armed goddess,

original: rtog par yang mi bdag gis bshad //🔽mda' dang ral gri g-yas na bsnams //
analyzed: rtog par yang mi bdag gis bshad // mda' dang ral gri g-yas na bsnams //
translated: Was also explained by the Lord of Yogīs.🔽Holding a sword and arrow in the right hands,

original: g-yon na gzhu dang thod pa ste //
analyzed: g-yon na gzhu dang thod pa ste //
translated: And a bow and skull cup in the left hands,

original: de bzhin du ni phyag brgyad kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni phyag brgyad kyang //
translated: Likewise the eight-armed one

original: rim gyur bdag gis bshad par bya //
analyzed: rim gyur bdag gis bshad par bya //
translated: Will be explained in order by me.

original: g-yas na ral gri mda' dang ni //
analyzed: g-yas na ral gri mda' dang ni //
translated: Holding a sword and arrow in the right hands,

original: rdo rje gri gug de bzhin du //🔽g-yon na autpal gzhu dang ni //
analyzed: rdo rje gri gug de bzhin du // g-yon na autpal gzhu dang ni //
translated: The vajra and flaying knife likewise,🔽and in the left the utpala and bow,

original: sta gri dang ni thod pa bsnams //
analyzed: sta gri dang ni thod pa bsnams //
translated: the sword and skull-cup.

original: sku mdog nag mo dang ldan ma //
analyzed: sku mdog nag mo dang ldan ma //
translated: She is black-colored,

original: stag lpags sham thabs kun nas mnabs //
analyzed: stag lpags sham thabs kun nas mnabs //
translated: wearing a tiger-skin skirt.

original: zhal gcig spyan ni gsum pa ste ;🔽/ ral pa kham pa gyen du brdzes //
analyzed: zhal gcig spyan ni gsum pa ste ; / ral pa kham pa gyen du brdzes //
translated: She has one face and three eyes,🔽her tawny hair streaming upward.

original: drag mo kun nas lto ba 'phyang //
analyzed: drag mo kun nas lto ba 'phyang //
translated: The fierce one is pot-bellied,

original: g-yon brkyang zhabs kyis yang dag gnas //🔽khro ba dang bcas zhal gtsigs shing //
analyzed: g-yon brkyang zhabs kyis yang dag gnas // khro ba dang bcas zhal gtsigs shing //
translated: standing with left leg straight.🔽She is wrathful, with bared fangs,

original: mgo bo'i phreng ba 'phyang ba can //
analyzed: mgo bo'i phreng ba 'phyang ba can //
translated: wearing a garland of heads.

original: ro la gnas shing 'jigs chen mo //
analyzed: ro la gnas shing 'jigs chen mo //
translated: She stands on a corpse, the great terrifying one,

original: mi bskyod pa yis dbu la brgyan //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa yis dbu la brgyan //
translated: adorned with Akṣobhya on her head.

original: lang tsho gzhon zhing phun sum tshogs//
analyzed: lang tsho gzhon zhing phun sum tshogs//
translated: Youthful, full,

original: mi bzad gad rgyangs 'phro ba can //
analyzed: mi bzad gad rgyangs 'phro ba can //
translated: she laughs a terrible laugh.

original: t'am yig sa bon las byung ba //
analyzed: t'am yig sa bon las byung ba //
translated: She arises from the seed syllable tāṃ,

original: de ma thag rkyen byed pa can //
analyzed: de ma thag rkyen byed pa can //
translated: the immediate condition.

original: sna tshogs padma'i steng du ni //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma'i steng du ni //
translated: On a variegated lotus

original: rab tu 'bad pas nyi ma bsam //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad pas nyi ma bsam //
translated: one should visualize the sun with effort.

original: hr'im tr'im h'um phat /
analyzed: hr'im tr'im h'um phat /
translated: hṛīṃ trīṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: mkhas pas ral gri'i gnas su ni //
analyzed: mkhas pas ral gri'i gnas su ni //
translated: The wise one should contemplate a garland of bones

original: rus pa'i phreng ba bsam par bya //
analyzed: rus pa'i phreng ba bsam par bya //
translated: in the place of the sword.

original: ji ltar sngon gsungs rim pa yis //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon gsungs rim pa yis //
translated: As previously taught,

original: sngags mchog yang dag bzlas par bya //
analyzed: sngags mchog yang dag bzlas par bya //
translated: one should recite the supreme mantra.

original: bsgom pa'i stobs ni rdzogs pa na //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i stobs ni rdzogs pa na //
translated: When the power of meditation is complete,

original: rnal 'byor snyan ngag chen por 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor snyan ngag chen por 'gyur //
translated: the yogin becomes a great poet.

original: 'bum phrag gcig gi bzlas pa yis //
analyzed: 'bum phrag gcig gi bzlas pa yis //
translated: By reciting one hundred thousand times,

original: 'jam dbyangs dang mtshungs thob par 'gyur //🔽sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs brtsams pa yis //
analyzed: 'jam dbyangs dang mtshungs thob par 'gyur // sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs brtsams pa yis //
translated: one attains equality with Mañjughoṣa.

original: bdag gis bsod nams gang bsgrubs des //
analyzed: bdag gis bsod nams gang bsgrubs des //
translated: Whatever merit I have accumulated🔽by composing this Sādhana of Tārā,

original: srog chags skye @165a * //🔽bo ma lus pa //
analyzed: srog chags skye @165a * // bo ma lus pa //
translated: by that, may all living beings🔽become equal to Tārā.

original: sgrol ma dang ni mtshungs par shog / ral pa gcig ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
analyzed: sgrol ma dang ni mtshungs par shog / ral pa gcig ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
translated: The Sādhana of Ekavīrā is complete.
